Description: Fragments of red, plain weave wool textile with multiple bands in undyed wool; a)=48(exc. fringe)x38cm, b)=31x31cm, c)=26x25cm, d)=11 (exc. fringe)x24cm; crepe threads; warp-red wool (S/c.17-21), weft-red wool (S/c.16), undyed wool (S); selvedge over two groups of warp thread with extra circuits of main weft, plaited fringes knotted at ends on a)c.3cm and d)c.4cm; other edges ragged or cut in modern times; lack of sewing suggest a draped mantle/veil type garment
Curator's comments: Unreg. 53; found in 1988? in Keeper's Office; balance weave is significant in bands and plaited fringe and points to a later date (compare 8th-9th century bishops dalmatic at Ravenna)
